unnormalised: Cracking those competitive exams, eh? It’s like climbing Mt. Everest in flip-flops, isn't it? But don't sweat it, my friend. We've all been there. From JEE to NEET, from UPSC to CAT, the coaching jungle is dense, and it's easy to get lost. So, let's talk strategy.
normalised: Cracking those competitive exams, eh? It's like climbing Mount Everest in flip-flops, isn't it? But don't sweat it, my friend. We've all been there. From J-E-E to N-E-E-T, from U-P-S-C to C-A-T, the coaching jungle is dense, and it's easy to get lost. So, let's talk strategy.

unnormalised: First off, figure out your strengths and weaknesses. What subjects make you want to do a bhangra and which ones make you want to hide under the bed? Knowing this is like having a GPS for your preparation. Maybe Physics is your jam, but Chemistry feels like trying to understand a Bollywood plot twist. That's okay! Focus your energies where they’re most needed. Aiming for 90%ile is realistic than a rank 1 without a plan.
normalised: First off, figure out your strengths and weaknesses. What subjects make you want to do a bhangra and which ones make you want to hide under the bed? Knowing this is like having a G-P-S for your preparation. Maybe Physics is your jam, but Chemistry feels like trying to understand a Bollywood plot twist. That's okay! Focus your energies where they’re most needed. Aiming for ninety percentile is realistic than a rank one without a plan.

unnormalised: Now, about coaching. Is it a must? Not necessarily. Some folks swear by it, especially for structured learning and doubt clearing. Institutes like FIITJEE, Allen, and Aakash have a solid rep. But remember, a fancy institute doesn't guarantee success. My cousin, Rohan, cracked IIT JEE Advanced without joining any coaching, just using online resources and NCERT books! It's all about your learning style.
normalised: Now, about coaching. Is it a must? Not necessarily. Some folks swear by it, especially for structured learning and doubt clearing. Institutes like F-I-I-T-J-E-E, Allen, and Aakash have a solid rep. But remember, a fancy institute doesn't guarantee success. My cousin, Rohan, cracked I-I-T J-E-E Advanced without joining any coaching, just using online resources and N-C-E-R-T books! It's all about your learning style.

unnormalised: Online resources are a goldmine these days. YouTube channels like Unacademy and Vedantu offer free lectures. Apps like Byju's provide personalized learning. Remember to choose wisely; don’t get lost in the endless content. Many good courses even cost as little as Rs. 499. Quality over quantity, always. Plus, don’t underestimate the power of good old textbooks.
normalised: Online resources are a goldmine these days. YouTube channels like Unacademy and Vedantu offer free lectures. Apps like Byju's provide personalized learning. Remember to choose wisely; don’t get lost in the endless content. Many good courses even cost as little as rupee four hundred and ninety nine. Quality over quantity, always. Plus, don’t underestimate the power of good old textbooks.

unnormalised: Practice, practice, practice! Solve past papers like you're trying to win a lifetime supply of jalebis. Seriously, mock tests are your best friend. They simulate the exam environment and help you manage time. Aim to solve at least 10 years' worth of past papers. You can usually find them online or in libraries.
normalised: Practice, practice, practice! Solve past papers like you're trying to win a lifetime supply of jalebis. Seriously, mock tests are your best friend. They simulate the exam environment and help you manage time. Aim to solve at least ten years' worth of past papers. You can usually find them online or in libraries.

unnormalised: Time management is key. Create a realistic study schedule and stick to it as much as possible. Don't prepone things just to look good on paper. Break down your day into manageable chunks, allowing for breaks and relaxation. Remember, a stressed-out brain is a useless brain. Plan for at least 7 hrs sleep per night, especially the week before the exam.
normalised: Time management is key. Create a realistic study schedule and stick to it as much as possible. Don't prepone things just to look good on paper. Break down your day into manageable chunks, allowing for breaks and relaxation. Remember, a stressed-out brain is a useless brain. Plan for at least seven hours sleep per night, especially the week before the exam.

unnormalised: Stay positive! Competitive exams can be mentally taxing. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family. Take time for hobbies and activities you enjoy. Remember, your worth is not defined by your exam results. If you don’t get into your dream college this time, there's always another chance. Many people succeed at their second attempt.
normalised: Stay positive! Competitive exams can be mentally taxing. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family. Take time for hobbies and activities you enjoy. Remember, your worth is not defined by your exam results. If you don’t get into your dream college this time, there's always another chance. Many people succeed at their second attempt.

unnormalised: Finally, remember to believe in yourself. You've got this! Prepare smart, stay focused, and keep your spirits high. All the best for your exams! And if you’re feeling down, remember that even Shah Rukh Khan faced rejections before becoming the king of Bollywood. If he can, so can you!
normalised: Finally, remember to believe in yourself. You've got this! Prepare smart, stay focused, and keep your spirits high. All the best for your exams! And if you’re feeling down, remember that even Shah Rukh Khan faced rejections before becoming the king of Bollywood. If he can, so can you!
